taskMan.view

Class ResourceView

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.view.ResourceView

  • public class ResourceView
extends java.lang.Object
    A resourceView is a wrapper for resources. The resourceView only has limited access to the resource and is thus safe to send out to the UI. The UI will hence also only have limited access to the underlying resources and cannot do anything unauthorized.
    Author:
    Tim Van den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

      • isDailyAvailable

        public boolean isDailyAvailable()
        Check whether or not the resource within this view has an availability period
        Returns:
        True if the resource has an availability period, false otherwise

      • getDailyAvailabilityStartTime

        public java.time.LocalTime getDailyAvailabilityStartTime()
        A getter to retrieve the start time of the availability period
        Returns:
        the hour and minutes of the day when the availability period begins, null if there is no availability period

      • getDailyAvailabilityEndTime

        public java.time.LocalTime getDailyAvailabilityEndTime()
        A getter to retrieve the end time of the availability period
        Returns:
        the hour and minutes of the day when the availability period end, null if there is no availability period

      • hasAsResource

        Check whether or not a given resource belongs to this view
        Parameters:
        otherResource - | The resource to check
        Returns:
